H0.text: By increasing photosynthesis, the interaction between flowers attracting bees and bees consuming nectar benefits the plant.

H1.text: By pollinating it, the interaction of flowers attracting bees and bees consuming nectar for energy benefits the plant.

H2.text: By limiting growth, the interaction where bees consume nectar from many flowers for energy benefits the plant.

H3.text: By reducing competition, the interaction in which many flowers attract bees that consume nectar for energy benefits the plant.

A4.text: When bees go from flower to flower collecting pollen they are also depositing pollen grains onto the flowers, thus pollinating them.

A5.text: By attracting pollinators like honey bees and increasing their foraging behavior, particularly in the center of large plots, we can increase grower returns and optimize yield from their plantings.
